translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Bhadraka
“I have left home, cut the craving, am unshaken,
(so said the venerable Bhadraka)
I have left delight, crossed the flood, am liberated;
I ask the wise one to leave conceit,
Having heard the words of the elephant, they will depart from here.
People from various countries have gathered,
Longing for your words, O hero;
You should explain well to them,

original: Tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo”.
analyzed: tathā hi te viditaḥ esa dhammo
translated: For you know this truth.”
“One should abandon all craving for grasping,
(the Blessed One said to Bhadraka)
Above, below, across, and in the middle;
Whatever one grasps in the world,
By that Māra follows the person.
Therefore, the wise one should not grasp anything,
The monk who is mindful in all the world;
Seeing the one who grasps as such,
This generation is scattered in the realm of death.”
The Questions of the Youth Bhadraka is the twelfth.
